answers.answer: I can't speak on cranial issues only diabetes. Your father is a diabetic and there is no turning back, only control - the insulin. Control helps bring glucose levels back to normal. Two factors that play heavily in diabetes control are moderate exercise and diet. Exercise helps burn off excess glucose. Can you father sit upright? If so, rig up a rope and pulley system so that he can move his arms in a push and pull method. Anything to flex his muscles and circulate blood helps. Being bed ridden, you can help control his diabetes with a proper diet. As far as supplements and/or homeopathic medicine curing diabetes, there are none. NO medical papers and NO clinical test trials proving supplements can eliminate diabetes. I do find that cinnamon helps me regulate not only my glucose but also my blood pressure. Medicine first said 1/4 tsp daily now its 1/2 tsp. So the jury is still out on that one. Don't get me wrong, I believe homeopathic medicine has its own rights in medicine, just not here, yet. Bear in mind there are a lot of quacks out there touting cures but only after you spent your hard earned $$ does one realize its a scam.

Thank you for the information on the cinnamon, I have also heard this and we have been giving it to him, not sure of its results yet.  Also for the heads up on diabetes and homeopathy.  He does sit up with assistance and we make him try to walk to the bathroom with assistance also, at this point that walk can ware him out.  We are also planning on traveling in the next week with him to Greece which is his homeland.  Any suggestions on flying with insulin, sringes and crossing over time zones?

I can understand how your father may get tired walking to/from the bathroom but he must continue to do so to maintain his strength. Don't let him get lazy.All diabetic equipment - syringes, insulin, test meters and lancets - are permitted as carry on items on an airline. When traveling, I carry them in a separate insulated lunch bag. Its not only easier for airline security to determine what they are but also for you by keeping everything together.It's best to discuss with your father's doctor how to regulate his insulin when traveling over multiple time zones. You also can post this question to Dr Ramsetty on the Ask the Doctor Forum, next door. Be sure to include his dosage and times when his shots are administered. Other forum members may come along and post their experiences too.

question: Hello,I am new to the forum and also to diabetes.  My 75 yr old father was diagnosed with diet controlled diabetes last November and now because he didnt control it, he needs insulin twice a day.  He was in denial about his disease and did not tell anyone about his doctor visits.  We found out because of a recent stint in the hospital.  Now he lives with us and is also bed-ridden because of stage 4 unknown primary carcinoma as well as met ca in the brain, we are now battling 2 diseases and I dont know how the current prescriptions after his blood sugar.  He would like to start on a homeopathic regiment for both diseases as we have already tried 12 radiation treatments and chemo does not look like a good option, can some please point me in the right direction for research and treatment.
title: new to diabetes
